page.title: 14THE CHURCH IN MEARS ASHBY.
page.content:
All Saints Church is built of stone and you can still see some sea shells in the stonework.
It was built about 1220 AD. The Mears Ashby Cross probably dates from somewhere near the year 1000 AD.
The Tower dates around 1220, and hidden behind the south clock face is a very simple Early English Lancet window.
Last year expert restorers spent a long time removing plaster from an ancient wall painting in the Church. This painting depicts HEAVEN and HELL and is called a DOOM PAINTING.
